node.title: EU court rules members must recognize same-sex parents and children
node.description: The court said recognizing families with same-sex parents "does not undermine the national identity or pose a threat to the public policy" of member states where same-sex marriage is not legal.

node.title: Bills fans help donate $40,000 to visual impairment charity
node.description: They're turning fury into generosity after they helped raised tens of thousands for a visual impairment charity over the span of five days.

node.title: 'Essentially fobbed off' - Sexual assault victims say they struggled to get help from ACC
node.description: Two sexual assault victims say ACC discouraged them from making claims and failed to inform them about the financial help they could be entitled to - and a lawyer says it's part of a long-running…

node.title: Partner of man who died in custody pleased someone is finally listening
node.description: The partner of a Hāwera man who died in police custody in 2019 feels like someone is finally listening after a report found officers failed in their duty of care.

node.title: Fatal injuries at work fell to 7-year low in 2020, DOL says
node.description: Most types of occupational deaths dropped amid the pandemic, but unintentional drug overdoses on the job spiked.

node.title: COVID-19 hits sports: West Indies tour of Pakistan cut short, Premier League postponements continue
node.description: West Indies have abandoned their five-match ODI series, while the Premier League cases hit new highs.

node.title: Anti-vax protest at a Cheesecake Factory ends in 6 arrests
node.description: Amid new mask and vaccine mandates, workers at restaurants and other public spots are dealing with belligerent customers.

node.title: Covid-19 wrap: Omicron in NZ, vaccine milestones and mandate protests
node.description: NZ's first Omicron case is identified, the country hit its 90 percent full vaccination target; children will be able to get the vaccine, and protesters outside Parliament demand an end to vaccine…

node.title: Mercedes drop appeal of controversial F1 finale, congratulate champion Verstappen
node.description: "We left Abu Dhabi in disbelief of what we had just witnessed.".

node.title: French Citizens Largely Barred From Traveling to U.K. as Omicron Cases Continue to Spread
node.description: France announced that travelers from the U.K. would have to provide a negative COVID-19 test less than a day old and quarantine for 2 days to enter the country.

node.title: Mike Lindell to Spend 'Whatever It Takes' on Claims Trump Won in 2020, Already Spent $25M
node.description: "I will spend every dime I have," the My Pillow CEO promised.

node.title: Derek Chauvin pleads guilty in George Floyd civil rights case
node.description: Former Minneapolis Police Officer Derek Chauvin has pleaded guilty to federal charges of violating George Floyd's civil rights.

node.title: Halberg Award nominees announced
node.description: There are 79 nominations for the Halberg sports awards, which cover the past two years of achievement following the postponement of last year's event.

node.title: Baker wants fewer people arriving in NZ with Omicron
node.description: As more Omicron cases arrive into MIQ, the more likely it is to escape.

node.title: Man who died in police custody could have survived if they paid attention - IPCA
node.description: Police assumed he was drunk and sleeping it off. He could still be alive had they provided him medical care.

node.title: 'I didn't know what sport was' - female refugees discover sport in NZ
node.description: When Fatima Hussaini arrived in New Zealand five years ago as a refugee she didn't know what sport was, now it's her dream to become a professional football player.

node.title: Aussies lose skipper just hours before second Ashes test
node.description: Steve Smith will captain Australia for the first time since the 2018 ball-tampering scandal, after Pat Cummins has been deemed a Covid-19 close contact.

node.title: All 17 missionaries held hostage in Haiti have been released, police say
node.description: Police said Thursday 12 remaining hostages had been freed.

node.title: Labuschagne leads Australia to powerful position to start second Ashes test
node.description: England were left to rue some missed opportunities, as Australia surged on day one of the day-night test in Adelaide.

node.title: French bulldogs suffer "much poorer" health than others, study finds
node.description: Data from British vets shows Frenchies' health is "largely much poorer" than other dogs, due to the "extreme body shape that defines" the breed.

node.title: 'As a result, he is dead': IPCA chair on action of officers
node.description: Police officers who failed in duty of care to Allen Ball fell short of expected conduct and as a result, the farm worker is dead, IPCA chairperson Judge Colin Doherty says. Audio

node.title: What’s Your Experience With Customer Service?
node.description: Tell us about what you’ve seen or heard as you shop, travel, dine out or work with customers in the second holiday season of navigating pandemic-altered plans.

node.title: How Benton Harbor residents are living with lead water crisis
node.description: Health officials have urged residents to use bottled water for tasks like cooking, drinking and brushing teeth. Officials say there's been a high lead presence in the city's water since 2018.

node.title: What to do if you catch Covid-19 on holiday
node.description: Along with clothes and snacks, also remember to carry masks and hand sanitiser this summer, Northern Region Health Coordination Centre lead Margie Apa says. Audio

node.title: Former NFL star found dead in hotel room had CTE, family says
node.description: Vincent Jackson had the degenerative brain disease chronic traumatic encephalopathy, his family announced.

node.title: Wind storms sweep through Midwest as Biden surveys tornado damage
node.description: President Biden is promising tornado victims in Kentucky that the federal government will help them rebuild.

node.title: $50 Million Gift to Juilliard Targets Racial Disparities in Music
node.description: The renowned conservatory will use a grant from a California foundation to expand a training program focused largely on Black and Latino schoolchildren.

node.title: Man accused in woman's 1993 murder can name other suspects
node.description: Steven Downs was charged with sexual assault and murder after DNA from a genealogy website helped match him to DNA from the crime scene.

node.title: Steve Bannon Hopes for Century of Pro-Trump Republican Rule: 'We Reign for 100 Years'
node.description: The former Trump adviser previously called for "shock troops" to prepare to take control of the federal government if Trump becomes president again.

node.title: 7 states have received half of the Afghans relocated from U.S. bases
node.description: In contrast, Hawaii, South Dakota, Mississippi, Alabama, Montana, Delaware and North Dakota had collectively resettled fewer than 90 evacuated Afghans.
